haxel.HxlGraphics

type
class

Static Variables

public LIBRARY_MAJOR_VERSION : Int

Assign a major version to your library. Appears before the decimal in the console.

public LIBRARY_MINOR_VERSION : Int

Assign a minor version to your library. Appears after the decimal in the console.

public LIBRARY_NAME : String

If you build and maintain your own version of flixel, you can give it your own name here. Appears in the console.

private _cache : Dynamic

Internal storage system to prevent graphics from being used repeatedly in memory.

private _game : HxlGame

Reference to the current HxlGame object.

private _mute : Bool

Internal flag for whether or not the game is muted.

private _pause : Bool

Internal tracker for game pause state.

private _scrollTarget : flash.geom.Point

Internal, used to assist camera and scrolling.

private _showBounds : Bool

Internal tracker for bounding box visibility.

private _volume : Float

Internal volume level, used for global sound control.

public autoVisible : Bool

If set to true, objects which are not currently on screen will skip rendering.

public autoZSort : Bool

If set to true, whenever an object is added to or removed from an HxlGroup, that group will sort its members according to zIndex, lowest to highest.

public buffer : flash.display.BitmapData

References the active graphics buffer.

public debug : Bool

Whether you are running in Debug or Release mode.

public elapsed : Float

Represents the amount of time in seconds that passed since last frame.

public fade : HxlFade

A special effect that fades a color onto the screen. Usage: HxlGraphics.fade.start();

public flash : HxlFlash

A special effect that flashes a color on the screen. Usage: HxlGraphics.flash.start();

public followLead : flash.geom.Point

Used to force the camera to look ahead of the followTarget.

public followLerp : Float

Used to smoothly track the camera as it follows.

public followMax : flash.geom.Point

Stores the bottom and right edges of the camera area.

public followMin : flash.geom.Point

Stores the top and left edges of the camera area.

public followTarget : HxlObject

Tells the camera to follow this FlxCore object around.

public framerate(getFramerate,setFramerate) : Int

public frameratePaused(getFrameratePaused,setFrameratePaused) : Int

public height : Int

Height of the screen in game pixels.

public keys : HxlKeyboard

A reference to a HxlKeyboard object. Important for input!

public level : Int

public levels : Array<Dynamic>

HxlGraphics.levels and HxlGraphics.scores are generic global variables that can be used for various cross-state stuff.

public maxElapsed : Float

Essentially locks the framerate to a minimum value - any slower and you'll get slowdown instead of frameskip; default is 1/30th of a second.

public mouse : HxlMouse

A reference to a HxlMouse object. Important for input!

public music : HxlSound

A handy container for a background music object.

public mute(getMute,setMute) : Bool

public numRenders : Int

Number of renders made for the current frame.

public pause(getPause,setPause) : Bool

public quake : HxlQuake

A special effect that shakes the screen. Usage: HxlGraphics.quake.start();

public save : Int

public saves : Array<Dynamic>

HxlGraphics.saves is a generic bucket for storing FlxSaves so you can access them whenever you want.

public score : Int

public scores : Array<Dynamic>

public scroll : flash.geom.Point

Stores the basic parallax scrolling values.

public showBounds(getShowBounds,setShowBounds) : Bool

public sounds : Array<HxlSound>

A list of all the sounds being played in the game.

public stage(getStage,null) : flash.display.Stage

public state(getState,setState) : HxlState

public timeScale : Float

How fast or slow time should pass in the game; default is 1.0.

public volume(getVolume,setVolume) : Float

public width : Int

Width of the screen in game pixels.

Static Methods

public addBitmap(Graphic : Class<flash.display.Bitmap>, ?Reverse : Bool, ?Unique : Bool, ?Key : String) : flash.display.BitmapData

parameters
Graphic The image file that you want to load.
Reverse Whether to generate a flipped version.
returns
The BitmapData we just created.
Loads a bitmap from a file, caches it, and generates a horizontally flipped version if necessary.

private changeSounds() : Void

An internal function that adjust the volume levels and the music channel after a change.

public checkBitmapCache(Key : String) : Bool

parameters
Key The string key identifying the bitmap.
returns
Whether or not this file can be found in the cache.
Check the local bitmap cache to see if a bitmap with this key has been loaded already.

public createBitmap(Width : Int, Height : Int, Color : Int, ?Unique : Bool, ?Key : String) : flash.display.BitmapData

parameters
Width How wide the square should be.
Height How high the square should be.
Color What color the square should be (0xAARRGGBB)
returns
The BitmapData we just created.
Generates a new BitmapData object (a colored square) and caches it.

public destroySounds(?ForceDestroy : Bool) : Void

parameters
ForceDestroy Kill sounds even if they're flagged survive.
Called by HxlGame on state changes to stop and destroy sounds.

public doFollow() : Void

Internal function that updates the camera and parallax scrolling.

public follow(Target : HxlObject, ?Lerp : Float) : Void

parameters
Target The object to follow.
Lerp How much lag the camera should have (can help smooth out the camera movement).
Tells the camera subsystem what HxlCore object to follow.

public followAdjust(?LeadX : Float, ?LeadY : Float) : Void

parameters
LeadX Percentage of X velocity to add to the camera's motion.
LeadY Percentage of Y velocity to add to the camera's motion.
Specify an additional camera component - the velocity-based "lead", or amount the camera should track in front of a sprite.

public followBounds(?MinX : Int, ?MinY : Int, ?MaxX : Int, ?MaxY : Int, ?UpdateWorldBounds : Bool) : Void

parameters
MinX The smallest X value of your level (usually 0).
MinY The smallest Y value of your level (usually 0).
MaxX The largest X value of your level (usually the level width).
MaxY The largest Y value of your level (usually the level height).
UpdateWorldBounds Whether the quad tree's dimensions should be updated to match.
Specify the boundaries of the level or where the camera is allowed to move.

public getFramerate() : Int

The game and SWF framerate; default is 60.

public getFrameratePaused() : Int

The game and SWF framerate while paused; default is 10.

public getMute() : Bool

Set mute to true to turn off the sound.

public getMuteValue() : Int

returns
An unsigned integer - 0 if muted, 1 if not muted.
Get a number that represents the mute state that we can multiply into a sound transform.

public getPause() : Bool

Set pause to true to pause the game, all sounds, and display the pause popup.

public getShowBounds() : Bool

Set showBounds to true to display the bounding boxes of the in-game objects.

public getStage() : flash.display.Stage

returns
A Flash MovieClip object.
Retrieves the Flash stage object (required for event listeners)

public getState() : HxlState

Safely access the current game state.

public getVolume() : Float

Set volume to a number between 0 and 1 to change the global volume.

public log(Data : Dynamic) : Void

parameters
Data Anything you want to log to the console.
Log data to the developer console.

private makeEven(val : Float) : Int

Used to counter the flickering of dithered surfaced when scrolling

private pauseSounds() : Void

Internal helper, pauses all game sounds.

public play(EmbeddedSound : Class<flash.media.Sound>, ?Volume : Float, ?Looped : Bool) : HxlSound

parameters
EmbeddedSound The sound you want to play.
Volume How loud to play it (0 to 1).
Looped Whether or not to loop this sound.
returns
A HxlSound object.
Creates a new sound object from an embedded Class object.

public playMusic(Music : Class<flash.media.Sound>, ?Volume : Float) : Void

parameters
Music The sound file you want to loop in the background.
Volume How loud the sound should be, from 0 to 1.
Set up and play a looping background soundtrack.

private playSounds() : Void

Internal helper, pauses all game sounds.

public resetInput() : Void

Reset the input helper objects (useful when changing screens or states)

public setFramerate(Framerate : Int) : Int

public setFrameratePaused(Framerate : Int) : Int

public setGameData(Game : HxlGame, Width : Int, Height : Int, Zoom : Int) : Void

Called by HxlGame to set up HxlGraphics during game constructor.

public setMute(Mute : Bool) : Bool

public setPause(Pause : Bool) : Bool

public setShowBounds(ShowBounds : Bool) : Bool

public setState(State : HxlState) : HxlState

public setVolume(Volume : Float) : Float

public stream(URL : String, ?Volume : Float, ?Looped : Bool) : HxlSound

parameters
EmbeddedSound The sound you want to play.
Volume How loud to play it (0 to 1).
Looped Whether or not to loop this sound.
returns
A HxlSound object.
Creates a new sound object from a URL.

public unfollow() : Void

Stops and resets the camera.

public updateInput() : Void

Calls update on the keyboard and mouse input tracking objects.

public updateSounds() : Void

Called by the game loop to make sure the sounds get updated each frame.

public new()
